content.question: A student has a small disc of unmagnetized iron and places it close to the north pole of a magnet. In the figures below, the arrows represent the alignment of the magnetic fields of domains in the disc. Which of the figures best represents the alignment of the domains before and after the disc is placed near the magnet?

choices.label: The figure presents the magnetic domains of a disc of iron before and after the disc is placed near the north pole of a magnet. The magnet is above the disc and the north pole of the magnet is on the bottom. Arrows in the disc represent the direction of the magnetism in the disc’s domains. In the before disk, the arrows are in random directions. In the after disk, the arrows are also in random directions. The magnet is above the disc and the north pole of the magnet is on the bottom

In the before disk, the arrows are in random directions. In the after disk, the arrows are all pointing downwards.
